body_html:
Just to make sure: your setup works fine on CPU?

I hadn't tried that. So I just now tested on the cpu by adding tf.device as here:

with graph.as_default():
     with tf.device('/cpu:0'):

and it did indeed run successfully. I'm not sure if there is some other way to make it run on the cpu, other than build without gpu support.

body:
> Just to make sure: your setup works fine on CPU?

I hadn't tried that.  So I just now tested on the cpu by adding tf.device as here:

``` python
with graph.as_default():
     with tf.device('/cpu:0'):
```

and it did indeed run successfully. I'm not sure if there is some other way to make it run on the cpu, other than build without gpu support.
